main.c

00021 
00022 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00023 #include <avr/pgmspace.h>
00024 #include "config.h"
00025 #include "planner.h"
00026 #include "nuts_bolts.h"
00027 #include "stepper.h"
00028 #include "spindle_control.h"
00029 #include "motion_control.h"
00030 #include "gcode.h"
00031 #include "protocol.h"
00032 #include "limits.h"
00033 #include "settings.h"
00034 #include "serial.h"
00035 #include "coolant_control.h"
00036 
00037 // Declare system global variable structure
00038 system_t sys;
00039 
00040 int main(void)
00041 {
00042   // Initialize system
00043   serial_init(BAUD_RATE); // Setup serial baud rate and interrupts
00044   st_init(); // Setup stepper pins and interrupt timers
00045   sei(); // Enable interrupts
00046 
00047   memset(&sys, 0, sizeof(sys));  // Clear all system variables
00048   sys.abort = true;   // Set abort to complete initialization
00049 
00050   for(;;) {
00051 
00052     // Execute system reset upon a system abort, where the main program will return to this loop.
00053     // Once here, it is safe to re-initialize the system. At startup, the system will automatically
00054     // reset to finish the initialization process.
00055     if (sys.abort) {
00056 
00057       // Retain last known machine position and work coordinate offset(s). If the system abort
00058       // occurred while in motion, machine position is not guaranteed, since a hard stop can cause
00059       // the steppers to lose steps. Always perform a feedhold before an abort, if maintaining
00060       // accurate machine position is required.
00061       // TODO: Report last position and coordinate offset to users to help relocate origins. Future
00062       // releases will auto-reset the machine position back to [0,0,0] if an abort is used while
00063       // grbl is moving the machine.
00064 /// -> 843 : 4 -> N_AXIS
00065       int32_t last_position[N_AXIS];
00066       double last_coord_system[N_COORDINATE_SYSTEM][N_AXIS];
00067 /// <-
00068       memcpy(last_position, sys.position, sizeof(sys.position)); // last_position[] = sys.position[]
00069       memcpy(last_coord_system, sys.coord_system, sizeof(sys.coord_system)); // last_coord_system[] = sys.coord_system[]
00070 
00071       // Reset system.
00072       memset(&sys, 0, sizeof(sys)); // Clear all system variables
00073       serial_reset_read_buffer(); // Clear serial read buffer
00074       settings_init(); // Load grbl settings from EEPROM
00075       protocol_init(); // Clear incoming line data
00076       plan_init(); // Clear block buffer and planner variables
00077       gc_init(); // Set g-code parser to default state
00078       spindle_init();
00079       limits_init();
00080       coolant_init();
00081       st_reset(); // Clear stepper subsystem variables.
00082 
00083       // Reload last known machine position and work systems. G92 coordinate offsets are reset.
00084       memcpy(sys.position, last_position, sizeof(last_position)); // sys.position[] = last_position[]
00085       memcpy(sys.coord_system, last_coord_system, sizeof(last_coord_system)); // sys.coord_system[] = last_coord_system[]
00086 /// 844 axis T
00087       gc_set_current_position(last_position[X_AXIS],last_position[Y_AXIS],last_position[Z_AXIS],last_position[T_AXIS]);
00088       plan_set_current_position(last_position[X_AXIS],last_position[Y_AXIS],last_position[Z_AXIS],last_position[T_AXIS]);
00089 
00090       // Set system runtime defaults
00091       // TODO: Eventual move to EEPROM from config.h when all of the new settings are worked out.
00092       // Mainly to avoid having to maintain several different versions.
00093       #ifdef CYCLE_AUTO_START
00094         sys.auto_start = true;
00095       #endif
00096       // TODO: Install G20/G21 unit default into settings and load appropriate settings.
00097     }
00098 
00099     protocol_execute_runtime();
00100     protocol_process(); // ... process the serial protocol
00101 
00102   }
00103   return 0;   /* never reached */
00104 }
